page.title: 06THE M63 MOTORWAY
page.content:
The Stockport extension to the M63 was opened in 1982. It cost Â£26m, and is 2.6 miles long. This section of the motorway was built to relieve traffic congestion in the Cheadle Heath area.
During construction the engineers had many problems to overcome. These included: re-routing the R. Mersey, builing temporary road bridges for Wellington Rd and Lancashire Hill, putting the motorway under the viaduct and building a retaining wall with rock anchors to contain the fluvio- glacial material upon which St Mary's church stands.
Since its opening a number of developments have taken place near the M63: the building of B&Q superstore, the Sainsbury and Asda development at Warren St and Orbro Cash and Carry.
